Title: Gather volumetric data about community content work
Description:
We need to have a clear vision of how much work the community has produced over the past years (a focus on 2015 and Q1 2016 is the minimum to get). The variation of the following metrics over the year is expected (not a finite list, suggestion welcome):* Number of contributors* Number of editions* Number of page initially created by contributors> **NOTE:** _"contributors" exclude pay staff and, if possible, contractors_It would also be interesting to know:* Change in number of pay staff members over the years* Contractor budget per year + volume of work done by contractors (number of articles created / number of edits)
_This requires to have a list of our contractors for the past years_---Data available so far (per month as the daily vision tend to be quite blurry):- Number of new user - Number of active user- Number of revisions- Page creation, redirection and deletion- User life time, time between account creation and first edit and account never activatedNeeded refining: Breakdown data per locales and per area of MDNBonus point: revision per user (aka top contributors list attempt) but it's a bit crude and needs refining.See the experimental [dashboard](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1GR9nO02gw0bm6e-M9WAefqlIEdwpOIK3CS-aWuGXfxE) of those data (_Does not necessarily contain final data that will be used for building the narratives_)---Useful definition:- ** Active user **: A user who created at least one revision- ** Staff **: Current writing team and contractor writer.
**Note:** _Because it is hardly possible to identify staff prior 2013, data that will take care of staff people will only start in 2013_
